intro: Oxydectes gnaphaloides, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. It has a low-growing, mat-forming structure with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Oxydectes gnaphaloides is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
